item.title: Russian missile attack kills 37 in Ukraine, hits children’s hospital
item.dc:creator: Mikhail Klimentov
item.description: Among those killed in Monday’s attack were three children, said Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky.

item.title: With Orban in China and Modi in Russia, Putin’s multipolar world takes shape
item.dc:creator: Christian Shepherd, Gerry Shih
item.description: As Hungary’s leader pushed for a Ukraine cease-fire, Russian missile strikes hit a children’s hospital in Kyiv and killed at least 37 across the country.

item.title: Thousands flee as Israel launches new Gaza City operation
item.dc:creator: Leo Sands, Hazem Balousha, Loveday Morris, Joby Warrick, Heba Farouk Mahfouz
item.description: As talks continued to sputter, Israel’s military moved into Gaza City in the north of the Strip, prompting widespread civilian displacement.

item.title: Playwright and director sentenced to six years in prison by Russian court
item.dc:creator: Mary Ilyushina
item.description: Theater director Yevgenia Berkovich and playwright Svetlana Petriychuk were arrested in May 2023 and prosecuted behind closed doors in Moscow over a play they staged in 2020.

item.title: A revived NATO marks 75 years, but political uncertainty clouds its future
item.dc:creator: Emily Rauhala
item.description: President Biden hosts a celebratory alliance summit in Washington, but the specter of Trump and right-wing populism in Europe looms over the proceedings.

item.title: What to know about France’s leftist alliance after shock election win
item.dc:creator: Anika Seth, Sammy Westfall
item.description: The New Popular Front wants to lower France’s retirement age and vastly expand government spending on social welfare, environmental protection and health care.

item.title: Divided France enters uncharted political territory after historic vote
item.dc:creator: Rick Noack
item.description: While an alliance of leftist parties came in first, with more than 180 seats, it is politically divided and needs 100 additional seats for a majority.

item.title: Copenhagen’s new sustainability push? Free coffee for tourists.
item.dc:creator: Andrea Sachs
item.description: An initiative from Copenhagen’s tourism office offers perks like free coffee and museum admission for visitors who make eco-friendly decisions.

item.title: How big elections are changing the world in 2024
item.dc:creator: Sammy Westfall
item.description: Some elections are cementing the status quo. Others are shaking up the establishment.

item.title: Is it cruel to cuddle a koala? Sanctuary stops hugs amid debate.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Pannett
item.description: Taylor Swift and Pope John Paul II are among those who cuddled koalas at Lone Pine Sanctuary. But the Australia park abandoned the activity after visitor feedback.

item.title: In lawless Gaza, cigarette smuggling fuels attacks on aid trucks
item.dc:creator: Miriam Berger, Hajar Harb
item.description: The thriving underground trade is hampering aid deliveries as chaos and lawlessness grip Gaza.

item.title: Ukrainian attacks on supply lines slowed Russians in Kharkiv, intercepts show
item.dc:creator: Siobhán O'Grady, Kostiantyn Khudov, Serhiy Morgunov
item.description: Russian troops invading Ukraine’s Kharkiv region are short of food and water, Ukrainian soldiers say, citing intercepted communications and interrogations of POWs.

item.title: NATO meets at a moment of peak uncertainty in the West
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: A sense of vulnerability and anxiety prompted by the rise of populist, far-right factions around the world looms over the upcoming NATO summit in Washington.

item.title: France election: Far right’s rise suffers unexpected blow as left surges
item.dc:creator: Rick Noack, Annabelle Timsit, Emily Rauhala, Elie Petit
item.description: Instead of ushering in France’s first far-right government since World War II, voters boosted the left and the center. But France may now face political paralysis.

item.title: French election results a win for left and center candidates
item.dc:creator: Rick Noack, Annabelle Timsit, Leo Sands
item.description: The populist, anti-immigration National Rally party had been hoping to install France’s first far-right government since World War II, with 28-year-old Jordan Bardella as prime minister.
